intro: Centranthus calcitrapae var. intermedius, commonly known as the intermediate centranthus, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white or grayish hairs. The flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, adding a delicate touch of color to its natural habitat.
